title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: Creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer. In the 'default value' field, input an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'. The invalid value is accepted, and the resulting definition appears in the report design.
EB: The system should reject an invalid date/time string during the creation of a 'DateTime' type report parameter. The model should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale-independent, ensuring portability.
SR:
1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string like '55/66/9999'.
4. Observe that the invalid value is accepted and reflected in the report design.
